result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Romero Lamont Dorsey

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Romero Lamont Dorsey in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Status Conference held.  State compliant with victim notification.  Defense requests a Final Pretrial and Jury Trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Romero Lamont Dorsey in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Scheduling Conference.
Defense counsel request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Parties advised the court does not have any trial dates available at this time and Court ordered matter adjourned back for a final pretrial. 
Jury trial date will be determined at the next court proceedings. 
Case remains calendar in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Romero Lamont Dorsey in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer, however, defense moves to withdraw as counsel at the request of the defendant.
Court Denied defense/defendant request at this time and ordered matter adjourned for a scheduling conference.
Case remains calendared in  Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (5/4/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.O. and M.P.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Romero Lamont Dorsey in court.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kori Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/02/2022@01:00pm
